chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Adam Czap

defendant.name: Czap, Joshua Adam
defendant.address: 1206 South First Street, Prairie du Chien, WI 53821

records.addlTxt: on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney - Crt appoints Atty Mark Frank

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
8:29 AM Cases 22CF92, 22CF113, 22CF125, & 22CF144 called together - appearances stated
 Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Joshua Adam Czap in court.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank appeared by video for Joshua Adam Czap. 

Judge states these cases are all on for adj. initial appearances - and all ready to be set for Prelim. Hearing
Atty. Frank states def. waives reading of complaint - prepared to waive preliminary hearings in all three (3) cases, filed waiver of prelim. forms yesterday in 3 cases
states he is not appointed on 22CF144 

Discussion re: Ct. Appointment in 22CF144 - Court states she is aware of defendant's income. Inquires how much additional he could pay on new case 
Court orders def. to pay $100/00 mo com. 1/1/23 on the 3 cases that previously had a $50/mo order (22CF92, 22CF113 & 22CF125)
Court finds def. to be partially indigent, grants petition for appt. of counsel, will appoint Atty Frank in case 22CF144 - Def. to pay $50./mo com. 1/1/23

Court reviews waiver of preliminary hearing and questionnaire forms with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing. 

Court finds probably cause and  binds def. over for further proceedings
Atty. Frank states they are prepared to go to arraignment today

State files the Information on all four (4) cases at this time

Atty Frank states if they track with the criminal complaints the def. waives formal reading - Def. stands mute as to each count in each of the four cases
Clerk directed to enter a NOT GUILTY plea to each count in each of the four (4) cases
Jury status hearing scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Joshua Adam Czap
Current: 1206 South First Street, Prairie du Chien, WI 53821 United States  (Effective: 10-03-2022)
Prior: Prairie Motel 1616 South Marquette Road, #52, Prairie du Chien, WI 53821

1:32 PM Defendant Joshua Adam Czap in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mark Walter Frank appeared by video for Joshua Adam Czap. 

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 

Attorney Frank is heard on being appointed to the fourth case.  Adjourned all cases so all four cases can track together and Attorney Frank can be appointed to 22cf144.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:00 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Joshua Adam Czap appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause. 

State is heard on bond. State recommends a cash bond $250.00. No driving without a valid drivers license. 

Defendant is heard. 

Court orders a $100.00 cash bond. Defendant is not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license. 

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
